solution.text:
Given points are : P=(_{i}_,_{j}_), Q=(_{{i-k}}_,_{{j-l}}_) and R(_{{i+k}}_,_{{j+l}}_).
Apply distance formula between P and R :
i.e., Distance = \(\sqrt {(x_1-x_2)^2 + (y_1-y_2)^2}\)
Where, \(x_1 = _{{i+k}}_ , x_2 = _{i}_ , y_1 = _{{j+l}}_ , y_2 = _{j}_\)
Substituting the values in distance formula to find the distance between given points.
i.e., Distance = PR = \(\sqrt {(_{{i+k}}_-_{i}_)^2 + (_{{j+l}}_-_{j}_)^2}\)
i.e., PR = \(\sqrt {(_{k}_)^2 + (_{l}_)^2}\)
i.e., PR = \(\sqrt {_{{pow(k,2)}}_ + _{{pow(l,2)}}_}\)
i.e., PR = \(\sqrt {_{{pow(k,2) + pow(l,2)}}_}\)
i.e., PR = _{m}_
Now, Distance between P and Q:
i.e., Distance = PQ = \(\sqrt {(_{i}_-_{{i-k}}_)^2 + (_{j}_-_{{j-l}}_)^2}\)
i.e., PQ = \(\sqrt {(_{k}_)^2 + (_{l}_)^2}\)
i.e., PQ = \(\sqrt {_{{pow(k,2)}}_ + _{{pow(l,2)}}_}\)
i.e., PQ = \(\sqrt {_{{pow(k,2) + pow(l,2)}}_}\)
i.e., PQ = _{m}_
Finally, find the distance between QR:
i.e., Distance = QR = \(\sqrt {(_{{i+k}}_-_{{i-k}}_)^2 + (_{{j+l}}_-_{{j-l}}_)^2}\)
i.e., QR = \(\sqrt {(_{{2*k}}_)^2 + (_{{2*l}}_)^2}\)
i.e., QR = \(\sqrt {_{{pow((2*k),2)}}_ + _{{pow((2*l),2)}}_}\)
i.e., QR = \(\sqrt {_{{pow((2*k),2) + pow((2*l),2)}}_}\)
i.e., QR = _{{2*m}}_
Here, PQ + PR = QR
Thus given points are collinear.
